channel.title: Beta Distribution on Amit Rajan
channel.description: Recent content in Beta Distribution on Amit Rajan

item.title: Probability Distributions - Binary Variables
item.description: One goal of pattern recognition is to model the probability distribution $p(x)$ of a random variable $x$ given the finite set of points $x_1, x_2, …, x_N$. This problem is known as density estimation. For simplicity, we can assume that the points are independent and identically distributed. There can be infinitely many distributions that can give rise to the given data points with any distribution that is non-zero at the points $x_1, x_2, …, x_N$ as a potential candidate.
